title: Nick Shaw (rugby league)
text:
Nick Shaw (born 1 July 1978) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a for the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a> and the <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a> in the <a href="NRL">NRL</a> in 1999.
Playing career.
Shaw made his first grade debut from the bench in his side's 28−16 loss to the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney City Roosters</a> at the <a href="Sydney%20Football%20Stadium">Sydney Football Stadium</a> in round 7 of the <a href="1999%20NRL%20season">1999 NRL season</a>. This would be his only first grade appearance at the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a>, as midway through the 1999 season, Shaw was released by Norths and subsequently joined the <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a> where he would play out the remainder of the season. His lone first grade appearance for Balmain came in his side's 22−12 loss to the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> at the <a href="Sydney%20Football%20Stadium">Sydney Football Stadium</a> in round 19 of the 1999 season.
Shaw was left out of the side for Balmain's final ever first grade game against the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> at <a href="Canberra%20Stadium">Bruce Stadium</a>. Balmain controversially merged with rivals the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a> to form the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> as part of the NRL's rationalization strategy. Shaw was not offered a contract to play with the newly formed team for the <a href="2000%20NRL%20season">2000 NRL season</a> and subsequently never played first grade rugby league again.
After his departure from Balmain, Shaw went on to play for the <a href="Burleigh%20Bears">Burleigh Bears</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> competition.
